Package org.keycloak.common.crypto

Interface CryptoProvider

All Known Implementing Classes:
AuthzClientCryptoProvider
public interface CryptoProvider
Abstraction to handle differences between the APIs for non-fips and fips mode
Author:
Marek Posolda

  • Method Details

    • getBouncyCastleProvider

      Provider getBouncyCastleProvider()
      Returns:
      BouncyCastle security provider. Can be either non-FIPS or FIPS based provider

    • order

      int order()
      Order of this provider. This allows to specify which CryptoProvider will have preference in case that more of them are on the classpath. The higher number has preference over the lower number

    • getAlgorithmProvider

      <T> T getAlgorithmProvider(Class<T> clazz, String algorithm)
      Get some algorithm provider implementation. Returned implementation can be dependent according to if we have non-fips bouncycastle or fips bouncycastle on the classpath.
      Parameters:
      clazz - Returned class.
      algorithm - Type of the algorithm, which we want to return
      Returns:

    • getCertificateUtils

      CertificateUtilsProvider getCertificateUtils()
      Get CertificateUtils implementation. Returned implementation can be dependent according to if we have non-fips bouncycastle or fips bouncycastle on the classpath.
      Returns:

    • getPemUtils

      PemUtilsProvider getPemUtils()
      Get PEMUtils implementation. Returned implementation can be dependent according to if we have non-fips bouncycastle or fips bouncycastle on the classpath.
      Returns:

    • wrapFactoryForTruststore

      SSLSocketFactory wrapFactoryForTruststore(SSLSocketFactory delegate)
      Wrap given SSLSocketFactory and decorate it with some additional functionality. This method is used in the context of truststore (where Keycloak is SSL client)
      Parameters:
      delegate - The original factory to wrap. Usually default java SSLSocketFactory
      Returns:
      decorated factory

    • getSupportedRsaKeySizes

      default String[] getSupportedRsaKeySizes()
      Returns:
      Allowed key sizes of RSA key modulus, which this cryptoProvider supports
